> --- In gladiator@y..., Tom Ricket <TRicket@b...> wrote:
> Hiya, folks,
>
> Just thought I'd jump in (I haven't been keeping track of the list
> lately, but saw this go by).
>
> About the Gladiator clone/improvement/etc. on SourceForge ... if the
> folks working on it (OpenGlad? :-) would like access to some or all of
> the source code, just let me know.  All of the original FSGames team
> is tied up 150% with Blizzard stuff, so we haven't had time to work on
> Gladiator in quite a while ... so anything we can get you to help with
> code, we'd be happy to supply.

We havn't thought of a name, but OpenGlad is a good idea :-).

We'd love to have access to the source, yes. Can it be provided under an
open source license? Instead of making a clone from scratch, we could then
port it to SDL (or some other cross-platform graphics library) and improve
it from there.


Also,

On Mon, 17 Jun 2002, dph_of_rules wrote:

>
> I would like to have access to enough of the code to produce a/some
> new version(s) of the existing game.
>

Dph, if you want to help us out at the Gladiator clone project on
Sourceforge, you're very welcome to join. If you're intersted, make an
account on Sourceforge and email me or post to the forums or something,
and I'll hook you up.

The same goes for anyone else interested to help. I think we'll get alot
more done if we're all working on one project instead of 2 or 3 different
ones.


- Zardus
